metadata.dc:author: Ferrer Ramírez, M J
Plá Mocholí, A
López Martínez, R
Dalmau Galofre, J
Estellés Ferriol, E
metadata.dc:description: Large tracheoesophageal fistulas (TEF) following a total laryngectomy are rare. Most often are associated with the creation of a surgical speech fistula or puncture. We describe the surgical technique used in 3 patients with large TEF after a total laryngectomy and the creation of a speech fistula with a voice prosthesis, followed by radiation therapy. Pertinent literature is reviewed.
metadata.dc:title: Fístula traqueoesofágica incompetente tras punción fonatoria. Solución quirúrgica.
[Incompetent tracheoesophageal fistula following phonatory puncture. Surgical resolution].
